alert.note: Alert for Langlade (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 4:35PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Menominee and southeastern Langlade Counties through 515 PM CDT... At 431 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles east of Antigo, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, torrential rainfall and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Antigo, White Lake, Neopit, Polar, Bryant, Lake Noseum, Elton, Phlox, Upper Bass Lake and Zoar. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
